ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of
ygData.msgSnippet: Of course those 30 mobs were the equivalent to that bard (at 40 something) that moss snakes are to me.  Who cares if I can mez 1000 except for a fun showoff
ygData.messageBody:
Of course those 30 mobs were the equivalent to that bard (at 40 something)
that moss snakes are to me. Who cares if I can mez 1000 except for a fun
showoff trick.

-----Original Message-----
From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
Sent: Wednesday, October 11, 2000 4:06 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com; 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of


At 02:06 PM 10/11/00 -0600, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>You got off lucky Galtin ;-) I woke up the next day and killed my entire
>party several times in succession before we figured out what was going on.

Well I have been playing a bard since April of last year. But at the time
of the nerf, I wasn't high enough leve to have the song yet. :-P

I do remember reading stories of bards in Blackburrow mezzing 30+ mobs at a
time, which probably prompted the nerf. However, now I believe you can only
affect at most 4 mobs, so that kind of solves that worry.

>It was then that we posted that the resist rates had been changed only to
>have GZ personally assure us that only mobs over 35th level got the
>secondary save. It took 4 months for that lie to be admitted and it has
>gotten more bitter ever since.
>
> Kit

Ugh. That's a customer service nightmare, from both perspectives. Well at
least we have peace in the Middle East. Hmm. No. How about we have tire
companies with good public relations. Hmm. Nah. Ok, we have a president who
has dignity and integrity. Damn.

Nevermind.

---Windleaf

with the subject submissions.
